website_summaries.verdict: A programmer and robotics fan’s dream toy, some kids may have to pry this pricey programmable robot away from their parents.
pros: EV3 kit and app are the latest in LEGO's programmable robot series
Fairly simple block-based programming starts users off
Compatible with NXT 1.0 and NXT 2.0 motors and sensors (but these older-generation parts cannot control EV3 parts)
User-created versions and programs available online
cons: Additional instructions must be downloaded to app or accessed online
Less technically savvy parents and children may be frustrated with initial setup and programming

customer_reviews.title: Best Lego product !
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for kids at age: 10+ if your kid have technical skills, it can be used also from age 6+ the package include all required parts. that's not so obvious from other Lego products. you can build many things with it, one robot with instructions in the box. 4 more robot with instructions from Lego mindstorms software. and many more robots from Lego site (can download PDF files). The box didn't included 1 long cable, I wrote to Lego and they sent me. Doesn't include 2 sensors: Gyro sensor, Ultra-sonic sensor. Price: 350$ (Lego, Amazon, ..)
customer_reviews.author: Thermofocus Non-Contact Thermometer

customer_reviews.title: I did not receive a Lego Mindstorms.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the photos, we received random pieces of Lego and other bits of plastic in this box. There are some Nerf pieces, a rubber lion, even a toothpick! What a disappointment for my 11 year old son. This had to be shipped to Saudi Arabia via an overseas account and I have no idea how I will be reimbursed for this. I'm being ignored by the seller. I've never spent so much money on a toy. It was a group effort between 2 grandparents and parents. I really wish somebody would make good on this and at least acknowledge it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia M. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kit. Fun for the family.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit. Fun for the family. This is the kit to get if you or your child are interested in learning / teaching robotics. It can be programmed in simple mode from the EV3 module without a computer. For more advanced operations, it requires a PC to program. We have had the software running in Windows 7 32 Pro, and 7 64 Pro. If you are on the fence with this product, look on Youtube at the things you can do with mindstorm. Our child was building and programming with this at age 9. The price was better here than Toys'R'Us. Delivery on time.
customer_reviews.author: Null

customer_reviews.title: Expensive toy, but a good teacher
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stuff: Easy for kids to use the intelligent brick More levels for more advanced robotics kids Lego lovers can make their own robots, or follow instructions provided on the site Teaches robotics skills through play. Great learning experience Could be better stuff: It could hold a longer battery life, (about an hour of play time on a set of batteries) So much extra to buy (battery pack, sensors, dongle, etc) Firmware updates take a while (need a device to do that) On-brick programming module is good for the basics, but for advanced features, you need the App on a separate device.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: My Son Has Disappeared
customer_reviews.text: Do you want more time to yourselves? Do you want to stop hearing about Minecraft, Fortnite, and Terraria? Do you want to be able to watch a full-length movie without constantly pausing it? Buy this. Yes, my son is programming complex things with this item, and he then diverges from the instructions to create incredibly imaginative ways to shoot marbles from a launcher, accompanied by sounds he has programmed, and he modifies it to go over carpet in ways the instructions never explained, and he changed the mechanics to ensure that it won't fall over on the taller pedestal he designed. But seriously, having a glass of wine and a movie without interruption is just so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Family Music

customer_reviews.title: One of the best gifts I've ever given.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson for Christmas. One of the best gifts I've ever given him. I know, it's pricey, but he has spent hours and hours and hours building fantastic, working robots. In school, he belongs to a Lego Club that builds projects for competitions. Having this set at home has helped him become a better builder and a more valuable team member. I'll be adding some additional pieces to this set for sure.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: 11 and 17 both love working on this robot
customer_reviews.text: My sons, 11 and 17 both love working on this robot! We bought our now 17 yr old one when he was about 11 and they now have both robots out climbing all over our home! We love Legos and the learning that happens as they figure out how to make it do what they want! Now the 17 yr old works on his truck, and finds creative answers to fix things all the time! I believe it started in large part by figuring out building with legos!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 10 year old master builder
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 year old master builder in my family. I bought this kit and he has not stopped making and remaking all the kits. The online community is great too. The remote is somewhat of a crutch but even that requires occasional troubleshooting. The price is too high for just any lego kid but if you want to teach your kid programming as part of their lego obsession this is a very good start. I wish the kit names were more simple... 31313?! Really Lego? You can't find a better nomenclature than that? Even kit 101 seems better...
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: FRAUD!! We received generic Legos in a Mindstorms box, NOT Mindstorms!
customer_reviews.text: The Mindstorms box we received was filled with other types of Legos (NOT MINDSTORMS as advertised)! My 14 year old son was very excited to open his new Mindstorm Legos this morning and extremely disappointed to find generic, pink, green, white, etc. Legos in the package instead. Someone obviously replaced the product inside the box. We've requested a full, immediate refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Miller

customer_reviews.title: EV3 Robot
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE their LEGO Mindstorm. They ask to "play" with it all the time. They are constantly programming and reprogramming it and have gotten quite good at it. I would recommend this product to be in any classroom or simply giving it as a gift. Kids will spend countless hours playing with it. Good for beginning programming. I recommend that you purchase a tool kit organizer to sort all the pieces. It makes redesigning much easier. Purchase this product, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive still, but worth the money IF you actually use it
customer_reviews.text: This kit is capable of far more than I originally thought. Check out some books from the library and PDF's from the internet, you'll be amazed what you can build and program. No matter what level of developer you are, there's something out there for you to intrigue yourself with. Don't stop with what's in the box and on their website, that's just the tip of the iceberg.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: So far my 9 year old loves it...same day Amazon delivery was AWESOME and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 9th bday. So far have only built the 'Everstorm' version, and he is learning how to program it. It stays together much more 'sturdy' than typical Lego set, and he is having fun learning how to program it (not the usual quickly bored). Will update if anything changes. Also chose same day delivery...worked out great...delivered to my door that day and for only just under $10! Would HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shmee

customer_reviews.title: Fun robot kit
customer_reviews.text: Fun robot kit. You can build dozens of robot projects that are fun and interesting. I found it a bit difficult to build my own project from scratch - I kept running out of rails that were the right size. Starting with a similar design from the Web or a book and modifying it works pretty well. I wish there were speach recognition and synthesis modules.
customer_reviews.author: G. Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: the most awesome lego set
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought EV3 would be no different than a Technic Lego sets. After I got one for myself and built a few default models from the website, now I have started to modify the robot to build my own models. It definitely sparkle my imagination to create something different. The con is even the software is easy for me to use and to program, but I think it's still too hard for a 10 years old. I would have to say it's a wonderful tool to educate kids on mechanical engineering and programming logic. If your kids could enjoy it, this box of Lego of $400 is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Y. F. Wong

customer_reviews.title: LEGO never fails to provide
customer_reviews.text: Included not only the parts to make the base robot outlined in the provided instructions, but also the parts needed to create the alternate robot versions available via QR code in the booklet. Software was easy to use to program the robots, and online demos were informative.
customer_reviews.author: BailiasCakes

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it for any kid with technical interest
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, a great combination of building with LEGO technic, playing with apps and computer programs all the way to sensors and real programming ...this will provide hours of fun and learning for the 8 yr old kidddo and is exactly the right step up from snap circuit and remote controlled cars. It is pricey, but it is certainly worth it IMO
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but pretty interesting
customer_reviews.text: Expensive. Would feel it's a better value at about half the msrp. But pretty interesting for kids 8 and up. Download the Lego Mindstorms software from the Lego website, it shows how to build the additional bots (the included user manual only shows how to build 1 bot).
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM introduction kit!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is well equipped for your children, or yourself to get interested in the field of robotics and simple programming. It's a fun toy to tinker with at any time of the week. One thing that would be nice is selling more, or including more lego pieces.
customer_reviews.author: John Parker

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a great product. My 9 year old son built a ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great product. My 9 year old son built a "security-bot" using this kit for his school tech fair. He watched YouTube to get ideas. Adult supervision is highly recommended since this is an expensive toy. You can use your regular Lego bricks to create your own design.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: My first LEGO set... EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 50 years old and never played with LEGO as a kid. After rolling both of my parents in a 3 month span I found an ad for this set on line and bought it as a mind diversion. 12 hours after opening the box I had my first robot build and I was hook - a newly formed adult fan of LEGO. It combined the creative part of my brain with the software developer side I am by career. This set is great for kids and adults alike.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard A

customer_reviews.title: Good base kit. Use Lego Technic kits to expand capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a good time messing around with this kit. I had to buy this kit along with the expansion set 45560 for an engineering class. But, If I did not need these two kits for class, knowing what I know now. I would get this EV3 kit and then bought Lego Technic kits to expand the capability of the base ev3 kit and not even worry about getting the expansion kit.
customer_reviews.author: matt hewman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this for my son. He hates it! Don’t buy it! We couldn’t program it. We were very disappointed. We watched the tutorials, still wouldn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Frantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this robot for our Girls Who Code club but the virus is keeping them from being able to build and code it But, once this is over, I know they will love it!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Stachelski

customer_reviews.title: So he improvised and has a pretty cool robot
customer_reviews.text: My 12yr old son loves it. He did his own thing and built the robot his way because he was having a hard time following the directions. So he improvised and has a pretty cool robot. I just think personally for this amount of money it could have wow'd me a whole lot more. To expensive for what you receive.
customer_reviews.author: chrissiaanda

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: my 9 year old grandson put it together in one afternoon... he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Most fun LEGO set ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most fun interactive LEGO set I ever had, the programming is easy, and I would enjoy it more if it were better documented or a real language, not the graphical block system it uses. I am sure it is hack-able and there are real languages for it. there are two types of motors, and they are adaptable to multiple projects. Gears and axles take a little bit of practice to understand. I am working on my design structures. So much fun. I have some cool projects in mind, and will be working on them in my spare time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Too much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son and I have had a great time building and programming the robots listed in the book. We've done a few original projects and have had a lot of fun with Mindstorms. The dining room table is now a Lego assembly zone (it is easiest to build if you can organize the parts into colors which takes a bit of room) and have spent a great deal of time on it and learned a thing or two. On the negative side, it is quite expensive and you always wish you had just a few more of this part or that part. Overall, a great toy and an excellent way to spend time with you kids.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Ericsson

customer_reviews.title: An excellent educational,fun device.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent,and fun, educational product. It has been a good device for children to learn robotics and programming. I wish it was around when I was in grade school, many years ago. The also use them in the schools to teach robotics.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: It does not work with Android devices
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment for my kid. He has been using lego and related apps on his tablet, and well as other robot brands. This EV3 is supposed to support android but truth is it is bugged and wont connect to any android device. After loong hours researching everyone has this same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son has had so much fun with this Lego kit (he's 11 but got it ...
customer_reviews.text: My son has had so much fun with this Lego kit (he's 11 but got it for Christmas when he was 10). It takes him hours to make most of the designs. You have to look most of them up on the computer as I think it only comes with one. Now, he's getting into making his own things, which is cool. It's a really good lesson in programming & building. Very STEM friendly. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Kids must-have today
customer_reviews.text: Got two sets for my kids (ages 11 and 12). Coding is a must have skill on today's education, so this is the perfect 'toy' to get your kids started, specially if they love Legos. Let them put together some Technics and get comfortable with more complex sets, which have some mechanical functions and movement. Then let them have the Mindstorms set and they will amaze you with robots programmed by them. Learn coding while having fun!
customer_reviews.author: Buck Marley

customer_reviews.title: Missing Lego pieces
customer_reviews.text: A number of Lego parts came missing with the box. When we opened the box, the return window was closed, so I ended up ordering those missing pieces worth another $35 directly on Lego website.
customer_reviews.author: TheTitan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my kid for Christmas and he loves it. He has built all of the robots that the website shows you and even some of his own. Our first build did take a couple of hours, like 4. But now 30-60 mins per build. It is very easy to program. My son started programming it at 9 and now he is a pro at it.
customer_reviews.author: OA

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is expensive, but thou shall not regret your decision. My 8 yeasrs old son LOVES it. To introduce basic logic programming, it is a great tool. Challenging and complexity is present to keep them engaged. Plenty of documentation is available to allow children to initiate building on their own. I highly recommend this product. Keep up the good work, LEGO MINDSTORM team.
customer_reviews.author: Minakshi Loomba

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tech Kid
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 12 year old grandson. He just loves it! He's made a robot, a race car, a machine like a printer, a game player, lots of other things. Kids must be adept at assembling with instructions, and it helps if they are familiar with simple circuits or electrical. Not for the young or inexperienced builder. But for a kid with tech savvy and ability to visualize a project--this is a great set.
customer_reviews.author: Like2Read

customer_reviews.title: Endless possibilities!
customer_reviews.text: My son(9) really wanted this, so we, along with his grandparents, gifted it to him for his birthday. Because it is so expensive, he knew it would be his only gift, but he still wanted it. I am so glad we got it for him because he loves it! The pieces have already been transformed into three different projects and the possibilities are as endless as his imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: A challenging lego
customer_reviews.text: We got this during the stay at home order during the COVID-19 pandemic. I had originally balked at the price, but now I gladly paid it as it gave my son something meaningful to do. He had worked with this system before and decided to try out his own designs. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan J Rehorek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent educational tool for beginner robotics training.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these (4 so far) to use in teaching entry level robotics to middle school boys and girls at the local clubs. It is being very well received with great excitement from the students and adults. The package includes many excellent robotic attachments - motors and sensors - and the software does an excellent walk through of the initial programs so it makes a great educational tool.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C. Charbonnet

customer_reviews.title: Dont regret buying it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a birthday present. He still hasnt explored it much but he loves it! He jought the beginner guide to help him with this. I will definitely update my review as soon as he explores it a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Myra Imran

customer_reviews.title: Mindstorms EV3  is a great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two grandsons as a Christmas present. The younger 8-year old really has mastered the Lego products, while the 11-year-old is quite the computer nerd. With their father's help, both kids have put together a pretty amazing robot since Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Georich

customer_reviews.title: He has blown our minds with all of the amazing creations he has made on his own
customer_reviews.text: Our 12 year old is so excited about this set. He has already added an additional motor and "eyes" and will also be saving towards the rechargeable battery. He has blown our minds with all of the amazing creations he has made on his own, in addition to building several items he followed instructions for. He found it to be very intuitive, but he does have a mind for this sort of thing, for sure He saved long and hard to purchase this set and he is thrilled with his purchase. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy & Julie

customer_reviews.title: but you can load the finalized programs onto your brick and just enjoy the building process and playing with your creations
customer_reviews.text: My daughters and I are LOVING this. They're 5 and 8, so we're not doing the programming end of things, but you can load the finalized programs onto your brick and just enjoy the building process and playing with your creations. My 5-year old keeps asking me "When are we going to build another robot!!"
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a challenge to get started, but so worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have been having a blast with this. The visual programming language is a bit to wrap your head around, but there are some really good tutorials on youtube (most produced by kids themselves). After tackling a few simple projects, we started on some more advanced stuff. Our latest is a robot which plays programmed notes on a harmonica! I wish the more complicated labview programming stuff was actually incorporated into the iPad app. (and didn't use Silverlight)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Herz

customer_reviews.title: Lego teaches programming and mechanical engineering!
customer_reviews.text: Lego hit it out of the park with this toy! My son (age 11) can't stop playing with this! In fact, he's joined his school's Lego Team and learned to compete and build robots that complete specific tasks!! The programming and mechanical aspects of this toy are vast and my daughters (ages 7 and 4) are also showing great interest too. My new problem is stopping arguments about who gets a turn at programming or building the next robot.
customer_reviews.author: ir

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old for her vacations and she took to it in no time and was up and running with her first creation within a few hours. Pros: Good kit, includes a good range of sensors Easy to program and build with the starter set of robots The starter robots have intermediate steps to program so it helps keep the interest going, this is usually a problem with young children Cons: Doesn't come with a storage tray or bins this is a big issue as there are hundreds of small parts Bluetooth interface is a bit flaky with Windows 8
customer_reviews.author: Sachin

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for creative kid
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for my little creator. Love the different creatures that can change to and best part is the programming. It was easy and fun
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived on time and kid is enjoying it now
customer_reviews.text: 13 year old son is enjoying the Lego Mindstorms robot it. The package arrived ontime and in good order. Very happy,
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kid played this during a lego camp in summer and wanted this as a birthday gift. He was so happy when he got this and best gift ever!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: object oriented programming and fun
customer_reviews.text: LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 31313 Robot Kit for Kids is over priced but I have seen nothing else that lets kids learn object oriented programming while having such fun. It lets the kids use their imagination and stretches their mind.
customer_reviews.author: Oldhand

customer_reviews.title: Its the one to have..
customer_reviews.text: Its a great kit! Its the same kit the school uses for its robotics class and competitions. Must have for the serious beginning robot builders and the motivated. $$$ but you pay for what you get MOST of the time.
customer_reviews.author: BluesHarp

customer_reviews.title: My ten year old is super happy with this robot
customer_reviews.text: My ten year old is super happy with this robot, uses it with his tablet to command it around the house. I thought it would have more programming, circuits to build, cables,etc- it’s very basic. Doesn’t really give the kid a real glimpse of robotics. He got bored of the programming offered by this robot quickly. But still fun. Maybe for younger kids. 👍
customer_reviews.author: giulia

customer_reviews.title: Love this EV3!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a huge LEGO fan and absolutely loves his EV3! He was able to put it together easily and now make modifications to design his own robot. It’s pricey, but if your kid is into robotics and engineering (science stuff), this is totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Marie Ulmer

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son (12) for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. It is easy to put together and there are tons of design ideas on the web. The programming is easy to use and can be sent to the robot either through a USB cord or via Bluetooth. The programs are cool and you can develop very complex programming if you want to. As my son is part of a First Lego League Robotics club, having his own Mindstorms to program has been invaluable. Great product for a budding technical kid.
customer_reviews.author: TorontoShopperJM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good instructive product but must be willing to spend time to master it. Not quite there yet
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Mindstorms rock
customer_reviews.text: We have the older NT3 system too and this new system goes further with a new sensor and updated master block. They come with directions to make one robot and you can go online for more directions. The new programming program is really nicely done and is a great way to get started with programming and robotics and problem solving (engineering) in general. It is a bit pricey unfortunately but worth it IMO if you want to get into robotics.
customer_reviews.author: teacher mom

customer_reviews.title: Awsome set
customer_reviews.text: This set is really good. it's durable and last a long time. Its fun because it never gets boring build robots, taking them apart, and build more.
customer_reviews.author: RFields

customer_reviews.title: You have to use your noggin
customer_reviews.text: I hope you know what you’re doing because this sucker will take brain power.
customer_reviews.author: timme

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the kid who wants to grow up and build robots
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old grandson loves Legos. He has always wanted to grow up and build robots. This was so much fun for him. He loved it. He can build many types of roborts with the parts and design and build his own.
customer_reviews.author: Merilynn

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it for our 12yo!
customer_reviews.text: Our son (12 yo) has had this for a couple months and loves it. Recommend buying the extra guide that has instructions for more than a hundred configurations. Easy to follow directions for building and coding.
customer_reviews.author: M. Arthurs

customer_reviews.title: It's Lego
customer_reviews.text: Great value, just like any Lego product. The only thing I don't like much is battery consumption. Very high.
customer_reviews.author: germano

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, so much better than the previous model.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I am shall we say older and I am having a ball with it. APP on smartphone or by PC, it is a breeze to program and use.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Angelone

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy
customer_reviews.text: My son is way into Legos and loves to create things. He had used the Mindstorm set at school and so we got one to use at home. The set had endless possibilities and is easy to get started and have fun within minutes. It is also complex enough to provide hours of creative fun. This is a great tool to teach kids basic engineering skills while they are creative and having fun. The software is even a simple version of Labview which is used regularly by engineers to run testing equipment. I would recommend this to any creative kid out there that wants a building challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Aspiring Grill Jockey

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy and very educational
customer_reviews.text: My son has been asking for this for two years and finally I got it for him for his 9th birthday. I thought it might be too much for him but he had the 1st robot built in two days. Once I showed him how to program it he's been off and running building different robots. Cool toy and very educational.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Messina

customer_reviews.title: It's expensive, but my son loves it. So ...
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive, but my son loves it. So if you have two to three kids who can benefit from it, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're on the fence about this, think no more...
customer_reviews.text: If you're interested in Legos AND robots, it doesn't get better than this. My son never had a robot before but loves Legos and has had his eyes set on this for a while. He finally got it and immediately went to town building the different model robots in the instruction manual. After building a few, he started experimenting and came up with a few of his own. He's now, for the first time, with a robotics group in school that's working on a challenge (using his EV3) for the upcoming Lego Mindstorm competition. It's definitely been inspiring to watch my 5th grader take his Legos to another level (and for me, watching where it takes him).
customer_reviews.author: M. Estrockito

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We found a Rubik's cube solver plans and software on line, and built it. Way cool. All the models that come with kit are really cool. Biggest gripe is that the complete plans for all 5 models are not included... So either have to print them or view them on a computer/tablet. Otherwise a great kit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Incredible introduction to engineering
customer_reviews.text: I was the recipient of the original Lego Mindstorms product and it was one of the sparks for my interest in engineering. I decided to purchase the newest version for one of my relatives who is just now exploring science, math, and engineering. I would, hands-down, recommend this product for anyone looking for a toy that inspires - Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: W Kethman

customer_reviews.title: Nice to start learn robotics
customer_reviews.text: Perfect educational toy. Can be base for endless amount of project.
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan Zhuravel

customer_reviews.title: Good product to keep a kid busy instead of watching ipad
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good product and very sturdy. Only concern is, its pretty expensive. Should be in the range of 200's in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Aditya

customer_reviews.title: High school robotics
customer_reviews.text: Lego is always great for a robotics class. We wanted to try out the new EV3. So far, it is great. I wouldn't throw out the old stuff for it, but the commander app for it is pretty cool. My only gripe is that the programming app only works with the educational set. I would even pay for the app.
customer_reviews.author: malathomikno

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Piece of Lego
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift and they love it! Great learning experience for future programmers!
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Middle School Robotics
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the speedy delivery of the Lego Mindstorms. We are using them to pilot a robotics club at a local middle school. Students are very excited about working with this product. It is our hope that this activity engages them and sets them on interesting STEAM college and career paths.
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: Daughters love it
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the instructional app to go with it, which is a free download and is so very, very detailed and easy to use. My daughters love this toy and I'm sure it will grow with them, from the canned stuff they're building step by step now, to building their own versions, to when I teach them how to program the brick themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Zhi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its a great way to introduce children to mechanics and coding...love it!
customer_reviews.author: AYB

customer_reviews.title: Great family project
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed this project. We are still working with it. It was a great project with the granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: J**********

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids interested in robotics.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old grandson loves this so much. He programmed them several different ways. Very good and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed

customer_reviews.title: Great parent and child product!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old was programming long distant trips and actions within hours. Pre-built design helped him understand the proram language (which is modular) and designs. Dont be afraid to let them change the design! That is where he learned the most.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, great for teaching or have as a hobby with the kids. You can find free software versions on line and save some money
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift!
customer_reviews.text: My Lego fanatic 9 year old son & husband spent every day after Christmas building with the LEGO Mindstorms EV3. I can't give specifics because I am not a LEGO fanatic myself but I haven't heard any complaints from the two of them & it's kept them busy over the winter break! It's a win! But then, most LEGOs are around here... :)
customer_reviews.author: M Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great product but expensive
customer_reviews.text: If you child loves building stuff and decent with an ipad or computer, they will love it. You, however, will not like the price tag. That being said, my son has been messing with this thing every day since Christmas and absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Mindstorm Use
customer_reviews.text: I choose the LEGO Mindstorms EV# 31313 to create a robotics enrichment unit for my 4th and 5th grade class. I coupled it with a book entitled Classroom Activities for the Busy Teacher: EV3 by Damien Kee. The students are enthusiastic and excited to learn the basics of programming through the robots they build and program. I developed a unit that incorporates math, science, reading, and writing around the LEGO Mindstorm EV3. 9 year olds through high schoolers enjoy the program.
customer_reviews.author: Norma G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product!!!! Bought for my 14 y/o son and he loves it! Lots of different programming modes and abilities. Super cool for kids who are interested in robotics.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Simply awesome. I love the brick and my 13 years old son loves to program and make the variations of robots... Its hours of fun as well as excellent learning for kids. the programming interface is very intuitive and fun to work with. I Highly recommend this product if you have anyone over 10+ at home.
customer_reviews.author: Santosh Gaikwad

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to consider about to buy this because of the price. But the product is really cool, worth the money. LEGO is always a great way of buying gifts for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dk. Mark Ma

customer_reviews.title: Great for potential engineers
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product and wish my grandson got one earlier. Technology is the future, so best to start them young
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting late elementary and junior high students interested ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting late elementary and junior high students interested in engineering and technology. It also gives parents the opportunity to not look like the opposition but as the able assistant as the child does the work.
customer_reviews.author: T. C. Brayshaw

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey but it has definitely provided much fun.
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY as described and my son loves it! A bit pricey but it has definitely provided much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Guz7

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a smart, young, kid.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my nephew that is slightly younger than the recommended age but he's super smart and isn't having any trouble with it, at all. He really loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gillon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works great! My son love it. Great gift for kids that love robotics!
customer_reviews.author: what's up doc?

customer_reviews.title: You can only build one thing
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this but he wasn't happy that he has to go on line to build the robot shown. The item is great except for that. I dont know why there isn't a book to make all the different robots and all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great First Robot Kit
customer_reviews.text: Some of robots are difficult for my son age 8 to put together, and for his mom too. It's a great kit and will start your budding robotics engineer with a good solid base. I recommend the LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Discovery Book to go along with it- it has a basic rover that is easy to build and very versatile and fun.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves creating all sorts of things using this Lego Mindstorm. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: budiw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loves building robots and programming them to do all sorts of things.
customer_reviews.author: Crunchy B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: A 10 yr old's dream. My boy loves his EV3 Mindstorms. He had the NXT and couldn't wait until the EV3 came out and he could have this set too. Now he is creating and programing robots. He was a part of a First Lego League and Loved it. What a great toy for an engineer minded kid!
customer_reviews.author: Home Educating Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fun Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for kids. I would not recommend this for someone who already has some programming experience. The programming method seems overly simplified for more advanced users.
customer_reviews.author: Jared K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing learning tool. Kids enjoy this and help them be creative.
customer_reviews.author: F. Khoory

customer_reviews.title: A Smart Lego
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? It's a smart Lego! You can't get any better than this. I homeschool our daughter and I'm using Mindstorms along with the EV3 discovery book to teach her (and myself) some robotics/programming. It's expensive but completely worth it. Get a companion book to go with it though.
customer_reviews.author: Taquito Bandito

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lego is always great! My son is learning how to program using Lego Mindstorms. Fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lego Mindstorms is Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is Awesome. I bought this for my Son because I was looking for something to do together to bond and draw closer to each other. This combines building, intellectual, analytical skills into one. Lego allows for you to go as shallow or deep that you would like to go on learning robotics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Teach you child structured programming.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first set for the budding roboticist. There is everything that you need to start programming the ARM9 microprocessor and learning about robotics. You will need a PC or a MAC to do the programming from. Get your child into a robotics club where he can interact with other like minded kids and watch him take off.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

product_meta.title: LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 31313 Robot Kit with Remote Control for Kids, Educational STEM Toy for Programming and Learning How to Code (601 pieces)
product_meta.description:
Style:StandardUnleash the creative powers of LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3! Build TRACK3R, R3PTAR, SPIK3R, EV3RSTORM and GRIPP3R faster than ever before with the amazing free EV3 Programmer App on your tablet. Then use the intuitive drag-and-drop interface to program your favorite robots to walk, talk, think and do anything you can imagine. When you're ready for more, fire up the advanced programming features of the EV3 software on your PC and Mac, or take instant control with the free Robot Commander app on your smart device or infrared remote control included with each set. Log on to LEGO.com/MINDSTORMS to access loads of cool content and interact with a huge online community of other LEGO MINDSTORMS fans. The LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 robot revolution continues!

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Builders of all ages will love building and coding their fully-functional robot to walk, talk, and even play games or complete tasks! This educational STEM robot toy makes engineering fun for everyone who builds it.

LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 is built with 601 pieces and includes the intelligent EV3 Brick, 3 servo motors, plus color, touch and IR sensors. Connect with your smart device and download the free EV3 programmer app to control the robot!

LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 comes with instructions for 17 different robotic designs, each with its own unique features. Builders can program their STEM robots to talk, walk, grab, shoot targets and more! Kids will love this creative and educational toy!
LEGO MINDSTORMS building toys are compatible with all LEGO construction sets for creative building.The perfect tech toy if you want to build your own robot and explore endless learning activities
The main robot, SPIK3R, is over 16” high, 14” long and 15” wide.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
